title: Whole home controls discoverability
quote: Benji wasn't aware of whole home controls, but was pleased with the feature once he learned about it.

title: Color interpretation unclear on home screen
quote: Benji struggles to interpret the colors on the home screen, especially inactive heat. Similar feedback was provided in interviews among field testers.

title: Light fade transition and low brightness UX
quote: Matt wishes lights would fade when adjusting the brightness, and struggles to set a low brightness on the App. The light icon gets in the way.

title: Eco mode accessibility in Whole Home view
quote: James wishes Eco mode settings were more easily accessible within the whole home view.

title: Heat/Cool mode request
quote: Asher wishes there was a mode similar to Heat/Cool.

title: Dial smaller than expected
quote: Chuck likes the Dial but noted how it's smaller than he expected.

title: Adaptive brightness for dial
quote: Matt wishes there was adaptive brightness on the Dial, especially because his baby sleeps in his room.

title: Scroll registering as tap
quote: James sometimes tries to scroll between rooms on the Dial but it registers as a tap.

title: Per-device temperature unit settings
quote: James uses Celsius and his wife uses Fahrenheit and he wishes he could use different units on different dials.

title: Apply vs Save flow confusion
quote: Sarah finds it strange that she needs to click 'Apply' for each aspect of her schedule and then also click 'Save'.

title: Time block structure vs calendar events
quote: Erin suggested the schedules should be structured like a calendar invitation with time blocks, instead of events.

title: Global schedule adjustments
quote: James notes how it's hard to adjust multiple schedules after they're set, and wishes there were global adjustment within schedules.

Adaptive brightness (auto-adjust)
